<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file implements generic type expansion and splitting for LegalizeTypes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The routines here perform legalization when the details of the type (such as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// whether it is an integer or a float) do not matter.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Expansion is the act of changing a computation in an illegal type to be a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// computation in two identical registers of a smaller type.  The Lo/Hi part</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is required to be stored first in memory on little/big-endian machines.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Splitting is the act of changing a computation in an illegal type to be a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// computation in two not necessarily identical registers of a smaller type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// There are no requirements on how the type is represented in memory.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/datalayout-h">llvm/IR/DataLayout.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using namespace </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm">llvm</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Generic Result Expansion.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// These routines assume that the Lo/Hi part is stored first in memory on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// little/big-endian machines, followed by the Hi/Lo part.  This means that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// they cannot be used as is on vectors, for which Lo is always stored first.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64isellowering-cpp/#a51cb24bd3e700fcf2f93d1afbb555a16">SDValue</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codeview/#aa8c11d016a2dd473a4cf0ed1da777f5eaf80f5476044d70697d689c8f32415ce9">StackPtr</a> = DAG.CreateStackTemporary(InVT.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#a1572b31fadbd0d758314b8d35a050410">getStoreSize</a>(), Align);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SPFI = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;FrameIndexSDNode&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codeview/#aa8c11d016a2dd473a4cf0ed1da777f5eaf80f5476044d70697d689c8f32415ce9">StackPtr</a>.getNode())-&gt;getIndex();</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Emit a store to the stack slot.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64isellowering-cpp/#a51cb24bd3e700fcf2f93d1afbb555a16">SDValue</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/spii/#ad2b7483c625986ac800ae1c31ae4cce7a36b3dd3b84fde3f8494a9b18af131856">Store</a> = DAG.getStore(DAG.getEntryNode(), dl, InOp, StackPtr, PtrInfo);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Load the first half from the stack slot.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9ac8e4e13ad96a39c3f8db9ed633ad2baff50b4aa1c9cc2197ef898436641c911">Lo</a> = DAG.getLoad(NOutVT, dl, Store, StackPtr, PtrInfo, NOutAlign);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Increment the pointer to the other half.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IncrementSize = NOutVT.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#a45e76d44a189e456d52e37ba3dda0fce">getSizeInBits</a>() / 8;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codeview/#aa8c11d016a2dd473a4cf0ed1da777f5eaf80f5476044d70697d689c8f32415ce9">StackPtr</a> =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlight">      DAG.getMemBasePlusOffset(StackPtr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/typesize/#a003b4369b4130e669dc9139798e0193c">TypeSize::getFixed</a>(IncrementSize), dl);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><span class="doxyHighlight">                   PtrInfo.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo/#a9459055a98e20980521289e8d20fcc7e">getWithOffset</a>(IncrementSize), NOutAlign);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>-&gt;getValueType(0).isVector() &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// An illegal expanding type is being converted to a legal vector type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Make a two element vector out of the expanded parts and convert that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instead, but only if the new vector type is legal (otherwise there</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is no point, and it might create expansion loops).  For example, on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// x86 this turns v1i64 = BITCAST i64 into v1i64 = BITCAST v2i32.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: I&#39;m not sure why we are first trying to split the input into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a 2 element vector, so I&#39;m leaving it here to maintain the current</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// behavior.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumElts = 2;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><span class="doxyHighlight">    EVT OVT = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>-&gt;getOperand(0).getValueType();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><span class="doxyHighlight">    EVT NVT = <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#a210ba6b43ba451b698857dd9de71bd15">EVT::getVectorVT</a>(&#42;DAG.getContext(),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><span class="doxyHighlight">                               TLI.getTypeToTransformTo(&#42;DAG.getContext(), OVT),</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!isTypeLegal(NVT)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we can&#39;t find a legal type by splitting the integer in half,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// then we can use the node&#39;s value type.</span></CodeLine>
